source.name: City of Detroit Department of Public Works
source.notes: Based on official Detroit DPW recycling FAQ and curbside collection guidelines. Plastics #1-7 accepted. Clean pizza boxes OK (discard greasy bottoms). Recycle Here! drop-off at 5960 Lincoln St.

materials.name: Plastic bottles
instructions: Set out by 7 AM on collection day
notes: Detroit accepts rigid plastic bottles #1 through #7
Weekly collection
commonMistakes: Don't include bottles with liquid still in them
Don't include foam or styrofoam

materials.name: Plastic jugs
notes: All rigid plastic jugs #1-7 accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include with liquid inside

materials.name: Plastic jars
notes: Rigid plastic jars #1-7 accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include with food residue

materials.name: Plastic cups
notes: Rigid plastic cups #1-7 accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include foam cups — those are trash

materials.name: Plastic containers
notes: Detroit accepts rigid plastic containers #1 through #7
commonMistakes: Don't include styrofoam containers
Don't include containers with food residue

materials.name: Newspapers
notes: Inserts and ads can stay
commonMistakes: Don't bag recyclables in plastic bags

materials.name: Magazines and catalogs
notes: Glossy paper and staples are fine
commonMistakes: Don't bag in plastic bags

materials.name: Office paper and junk mail
notes: Detroit specifically notes window envelopes are accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include paper towels or tissues
Don't bag in plastic bags

materials.name: Flattened cardboard
notes: Remove packing materials
commonMistakes: Don't leave boxes unflattened
Don't bag recyclables

materials.name: Paperboard / thin cardboard
notes: Thin cardboard boxes accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include heavily food-soiled boxes

materials.name: Pizza box (clean)
instructions: Clean pizza boxes are OK for recycling
Discard greasy bottom portions — trash those
Place clean portions in blue recycling cart
notes: Detroit specifically accepts clean pizza boxes — discard greasy bottoms
commonMistakes: Don't recycle the greasy bottom — tear it off and trash it

materials.name: Pizza box (greasy bottom)
instructions: Greasy portions go in regular trash
Tear off clean top for recycling if possible
notes: Grease contaminates paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy cardboard in the blue cart

materials.name: Aluminum cans
notes: Detroit specifically notes labels can stay on aluminum
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with liquid

materials.name: Aluminum foil (clean)
notes: Labels can stay on aluminum products
commonMistakes: Don't recycle heavily soiled foil

materials.name: Aluminum trays
notes: Labels can stay on
commonMistakes: Don't include heavily soiled trays

materials.name: Steel / tin cans
notes: Detroit notes labels can stay on metal cans
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food still in them

materials.name: Glass food and beverage bottles
notes: Detroit accepts food and beverage glass bottles
All colors accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include window glass, vases, mirrors, or drinking glasses
Don't include broken glass

materials.name: Glass food and beverage jars
notes: Food and beverage glass jars accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include ceramics or drinking glasses

materials.name: Books
instructions: Otherwise place in blue recycling cart
notes: Donating preferred
commonMistakes: Don't throw usable books in trash

materials.name: Aerosol cans (empty)
notes: Non-empty aerosols are hazardous
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized

materials.name: Beverage cartons
notes: Beverage cartons accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include with liquid inside

materials.name: Plastic bags
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling cart
Take clean dry bags to grocery store collection bins
notes: Detroit explicitly prohibits plastic bags in recycling
Bags jam sorting machinery
commonMistakes: Never bag recyclables in plastic bags — items must be loose in the blue cart
Don't put any film plastic in the blue cart

materials.name: Plastic straws
notes: Detroit explicitly lists straws as not accepted
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Plastic utensils
notes: Detroit explicitly lists utensils as not accepted
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Styrofoam / polystyrene
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling cart or regular trash
Take to Recycle Here! drop-off at 5960 Lincoln St.
notes: Detroit has a special drop-off program for styrofoam at Recycle Here!
Not accepted in curbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart
Take to Recycle Here! for proper recycling

materials.name: Shrink wrap / plastic film
instructions: Or take plastic film to grocery store collection bins
notes: Detroit explicitly lists shrink wrap as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Bubble wrap
instructions: Detroit explicitly lists bubble wrap as not accepted
notes: Film plastics jam sorting machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Food waste
instructions: Detroit does not have curbside composting
notes: Detroit explicitly notes food and liquids are not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put food waste in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Fruit and fruit scraps
notes: No curbside composting in Detroit
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Vegetables and vegetable scraps
notes: No curbside composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Meat and bones
instructions: Bag and place in regular trash
notes: No curbside composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Coffee grounds / tea bags
notes: No curbside composting; consider home composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Dairy products
instructions: Food portion goes in regular trash
notes: Separate container from contents
commonMistakes: Don't recycle containers with food still in them

materials.name: Glass vases
notes: Detroit explicitly prohibits glass vases in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Window glass / mirrors
instructions: Wrap carefully in newspaper or cardboard
notes: Detroit explicitly prohibits window glass and mirrors in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Drinking glasses / cups
instructions: Wrap and place in regular trash
notes: Detroit explicitly lists drinking cups as not accepted in recycling — different glass composition
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart with bottle glass

materials.name: Propane tanks
instructions: Do NOT put in any curbside cart
Take to a hazardous waste collection event
Or take to Recycle Here! drop-off
notes: Detroit explicitly lists propane tanks as not accepted in recycling
Fire and explosion risk
commonMistakes: Never puncture
Never put in trash or recycling

materials.name: Paint cans
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling cart or regular trash
Take to Detroit hazardous waste collection or Recycle Here!
Latex paint: dry out with kitty litter then trash can
notes: Detroit explicitly lists paint cans as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't pour paint down the drain
Don't put liquid paint in trash

materials.name: Chemicals and cleaners
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling cart or regular trash
Take to hazardous waste collection event
notes: Detroit explicitly lists chemicals and cleaners as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains
Don't put in regular trash

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Do NOT put in any curbside cart
Take to Recycle Here! at 5960 Lincoln St. or hazardous waste event
Tape terminals of lithium and 9V batteries
notes: Detroit explicitly lists batteries as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't throw batteries in trash or recycling

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL/fluorescent: take to Recycle Here! or hazardous waste event (contains mercury)
LED/incandescent: wrap and place in regular trash
Do NOT put any bulbs in the blue recycling cart
notes: Detroit explicitly lists light bulbs as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart
Handle CFL bulbs carefully

materials.name: Electronics / E-waste
instructions: Do NOT put in any curbside cart
Take to Recycle Here! at 5960 Lincoln St.
Or take to a Best Buy or Staples for free recycling
notes: Detroit explicitly lists electronics as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put electronics in trash or recycling
Don't forget to wipe personal data

materials.name: Yard waste
instructions: Place in yard waste bags for separate collection
Do NOT put in blue recycling cart
notes: Detroit has separate yard waste collection schedules
Not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Construction debris
instructions: Not accepted in blue recycling cart
Contact Detroit DPW for disposal options
notes: Detroit explicitly lists construction materials as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Bagged recyclables
instructions: Do NOT bag recyclables — items must be LOOSE in the blue cart
If bagged, workers may skip the entire bag
Remove items from bags and place loose in cart
notes: Detroit explicitly states bagged recyclables are not accepted
All items must be placed loose in the blue cart
commonMistakes: Never bag recyclables in plastic bags
Always place items loose in the blue cart

materials.name: Candy wrapper
notes: Multi-layer film packaging cannot be recycled
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Chip bag / snack bag
notes: Metallized plastic cannot be recycled
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Diapers
instructions: Bag and place in regular trash
notes: Not recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Receipts
notes: Cannot be recycled
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Pet waste
instructions: Bag and place in regular trash
notes: Not recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't flush cat litter

materials.name: Clothing / textiles
instructions: Donate to Goodwill, Salvation Army, or local charities
Take to Recycle Here! at 5960 Lincoln St.
notes: Don't put in any curbside cart
commonMistakes: Don't put clothing in trash if donatable

materials.name: Medications
instructions: Take to a pharmacy drug take-back location
If no drop-off: mix with coffee grounds, seal, and trash
notes: Never flush medications
commonMistakes: Don't flush medications
Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Smartphone / cell phone
instructions: Factory reset and wipe personal data
Take to Recycle Here! or Best Buy
notes: Contains valuable recoverable materials
commonMistakes: Don't forget to wipe personal data
Don't put in trash — battery fire risk

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to auto parts store or hazardous waste collection
notes: Most auto parts stores accept oil for free
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains or storm sewers

materials.name: Furniture / large items
instructions: Schedule bulk pickup through Detroit DPW
Or take to a disposal facility
notes: Detroit offers bulk item pickup — contact DPW
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Appliances
instructions: Remove doors from refrigerators for safety
notes: Appliances contain recyclable metals
commonMistakes: Don't put in regular trash

materials.name: Tires
instructions: Take to a tire retailer or Recycle Here! drop-off
notes: Not accepted in curbside carts
commonMistakes: Don't dump illegally

materials.name: Ceramics / pottery
notes: Ceramics contaminate glass recycling
commonMistakes: Don't mix with glass recyclables

materials.name: Wax paper / parchment paper
notes: Coating prevents recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Hangers
notes: Wire hangers tangle in recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Makeup / cosmetics containers
instructions: Clean rigid plastic containers may go in blue cart
notes: Small items fall through sorting screens
commonMistakes: Don't put nail polish in regular trash

materials.name: Chargers and cables
instructions: Take to Recycle Here! or Best Buy
Do NOT put in blue recycling cart
notes: Cables tangle in recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put cables in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Ink / toner cartridges
instructions: Return to Staples or Office Depot
Take to Recycle Here! at 5960 Lincoln St.
notes: Some stores give credit for returns
commonMistakes: Don't throw in regular trash

materials.name: Plastic bags (drop-off recycling)
instructions: Take clean, dry plastic bags to Recycle Here! at 5960 Lincoln St.
Many grocery stores also have bag collection bins
notes: Recycle Here! accepts plastic bags that can't go in curbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling cart — must go to drop-off

recycle: Newspapers, magazines, catalogs, office paper, junk mail (window envelopes OK)
Rigid plastic bottles, jugs, jars, cups, and containers #1-7
Flattened cardboard (clean pizza boxes OK — discard greasy bottoms)
Aluminum cans, foil, and trays (labels can stay on)
Glass food and beverage bottles and jars
trash: Plastic bags, straws, utensils, styrofoam, shrink wrap, bubble wrap
Glass vases, window glass, mirrors, drinking glasses/cups

recycle: Glass vases, window glass, mirrors, drinking cups
Propane tanks, paint cans, chemicals, cleaners
Bagged recyclables — all items must be loose

tips: Detroit uses BLUE carts for recycling — weekly collection
Set out carts by 7 AM on collection day
Detroit accepts ALL rigid plastics #1 through #7 — more flexible than most cities
All items must be LOOSE in the blue cart — do NOT bag recyclables
Labels can stay on aluminum cans, foil, trays, and steel cans
Clean pizza boxes are recyclable — discard greasy bottoms
Window glass, mirrors, vases, and drinking glasses are NOT recyclable
Recycle Here! drop-off at 5960 Lincoln St. accepts hard-to-recycle items (styrofoam, plastic bags, electronics, etc.)
No curbside composting program — food waste goes in regular trash
Contact Detroit DPW for bulk item pickup scheduling

locations.name: Recycle Here!
locations.notes: Free drop-off for Detroit residents. Accepts many hard-to-recycle items not accepted in curbside recycling. Located in the Lincoln Street Art Park area.
